db:abstract.db:para: The QOperatingSystemVersion class provides information about the operating system version.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Unlike other version functions in QSysInfo, QOperatingSystemVersion provides access to the full version number that developers typically use to vary behavior or determine whether to enable APIs or features based on the operating system version (as opposed to the kernel version number or marketing version).
Presently, Android, Apple Platforms (iOS, macOS, tvOS, watchOS, and visionOS), and Windows are supported.
The majorVersion(), minorVersion(), and microVersion() functions return the parts of the operating system version number based on:

db:td.db:para: result of parsing android.os.Build.VERSION.RELEASE using QVersionNumber, with a fallback to android.os.Build.VERSION.SDK_INT to determine the major and minor version component if the former fails
majorVersion, minorVersion, and patchVersion from NSProcessInfo.operatingSystemVersion

dwMajorVersion, dwMinorVersion, and dwBuildNumber from RtlGetVersion - note that this function ALWAYS return the version number of the underlying operating system, as opposed to the shim underneath GetVersionEx that hides the real version number if the application is not manifested for that version of the OS

db:section.db:para: Because QOperatingSystemVersion stores both a version number and an OS type, the OS type can be taken into account when performing comparisons. For example, on a macOS system running macOS Sierra (v10.12), the following expression will return false even though the major version number component of the object on the left hand side of the expression (10) is greater than that of the object on the right (9):
This allows expressions for multiple operating systems to be joined with a logical OR operator and still work as expected. For example:

A more naive comparison algorithm might incorrectly return true on all versions of macOS, including Mac OS 9. This behavior is achieved by overloading the comparison operators to return false whenever the OS types of the QOperatingSystemVersion instances being compared do not match. Be aware that due to this it can be the case x >= y and x < y are BOTH false for the same instances of x and y.

db:section.db:title: enum QOperatingSystemVersion::OSType
db:section.db:para: This enum provides symbolic names for the various operating system families supported by QOperatingSystemVersion.

db:td.db:para: An unknown or unsupported operating system.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QOperatingSystemVersion::QOperatingSystemVersion(QOperatingSystemVersion::OSType osType, int vmajor, int vminor = -1, int vmicro = -1)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a QOperatingSystemVersion consisting of the OS type osType, and major, minor, and micro version numbers vmajor, vminor and vmicro, respectively.

db:section.db:title: [static] QOperatingSystemVersion QOperatingSystemVersion::current()
db:section.db:para: Returns a QOperatingSystemVersion indicating the current OS and its version number.

db:section.db:title: [static constexpr] QOperatingSystemVersion::OSType QOperatingSystemVersion::currentType()
db:section.db:para: Returns the current OS type without constructing a QOperatingSystemVersion instance.

db:section.db:title: bool QOperatingSystemVersion::isAnyOfType(std::initializer_list<QOperatingSystemVersion::OSType> types) const
db:section.db:para: Returns whether the OS type identified by the QOperatingSystemVersion matches any of the OS types in types.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int QOperatingSystemVersion::majorVersion() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the major version number, that is, the first segment of the operating system's version number.
See the main class documentation for what the major version number is on a given operating system.
-1 indicates an unknown or absent version number component.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int QOperatingSystemVersion::microVersion() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the micro version number, that is, the third segment of the operating system's version number.
See the main class documentation for what the micro version number is on a given operating system.
-1 indicates an unknown or absent version number component.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int QOperatingSystemVersion::minorVersion() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the minor version number, that is, the second segment of the operating system's version number.
See the main class documentation for what the minor version number is on a given operating system.
-1 indicates an unknown or absent version number component.

db:section.db:title: QString QOperatingSystemVersion::name() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a string representation of the OS type identified by the QOperatingSystemVersion.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] int QOperatingSystemVersion::segmentCount() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of integers stored in the version number.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QOperatingSystemVersion::OSType QOperatingSystemVersion::type() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the OS type identified by the QOperatingSystemVersion.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.1] QVersionNumber QOperatingSystemVersion::version() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the operating system's version number.
See the main class documentation for what the version number is on a given operating system.
This function was introduced in Qt 6.1.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.1] const QOperatingSystemVersion QOperatingSystemVersion::Android10
db:section.db:para: This variable holds a version corresponding to Android 10 (version 10.0, API level 29).
This documentation was introduced in Qt 6.1.
